alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 09 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Massachusetts, including the following counties, Franklin and Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 421 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Amherst, Northampton, Greenfield, Deerfield, Montague, Hadley, Sunderland, Hatfield, Williamsburg, Huntington, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Leverett, Ashfield, Colrain, Westhampton, Gill, Whately and Charlemont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
